INGREDIENTS:

 •Black eyed bean - 1/2 cup
 •Onion - 2 medium size
 •Tomato - 3 medium size
 •Garlic - 3 cloves
 •Ginger - 1 inch piece
 •Coconut grated - 2 tbsp
 •Salt needed

 Spice powder: 

•Chilli powder -1 tsp
 •Coriander powder -2 tsp
 •Cumin powder - 3/4 tsp
 •Garam masala or kitchen king masala -1 tsp
 •Turmeric powder -1/4 tsp

 For the seasoning : 

•Oil - 2 tbsp
 •Cumin seeds/jeera - 1 tsp
 •Curry leaves - few (optional) 

 PREPARATION: 
 1. Wash and soak black eyed beans in water overnight or for 5-6 hours. Pressure cook for 3 whistles with just enough water to cover the lobia. Add little salt and turmeric powder. 
 2. Grind tomato, onion, garlic, ginger and coconut to a smooth paste and keep it ready. (picture below) 

 METHOD: 
 1. Heat oil in a pressure pan, add cumin seeds, when it splutters, add the ground paste, all the spice powder, salt needed and cook until oil separates stirring continuously. 
 2. Add the cooked black eyed beans (lobia), 1 cup of water and pressure cook for another 2 whistles. 
 3. Once the pressure subsides, open the cooker, mix the gravy well and boil for another 2-3 minutes on low flame. 
 4. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with roti, naan, parathas or poori. 

 Note : 
 You can substitute black eyed bean with any other bean seed and follow the same recipe. 

If you do not want to pressure cook again, cook lobia until soft when you pressure cook the first time itself.
